byline.contributor: Shehu Abubakar contributed reporting from Maiduguri, Nigeria, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Series of bombings in northern Nigerian town of Maiduguri and attributed to Boko Haram, kill over 100 people; attackers take advantage of Muslim holiday celebrations to maximize casualties, and cast doubt on government's continued assurances that Islamist extremist group is being stamped out.
lead_paragraph: The blasts appeared to be carefully coordinated and countered assertions by Nigerian officials that Boko Haram had been severely weakened.

headline.main: More than 100 Killed by Boko Haram Bombings in Nigeria
headline.print_headline: Scores Are Killed in Nigeria in Boko Haram Bombings

snippet: The blasts appeared to be carefully coordinated and countered assertions by Nigerian officials that Boko Haram had been severely weakened.
